title_full: SAAS03-BP01 Implement throttling to limit tenant load impact on system reliability
title: Implement throttling to limit tenant load impact on system reliability
description: Use throttling to prevent tenants from consuming excess resources and impacting system reliability. Leverage Amazon API Gateway usage plans to define separate usage experiences for each tenant tier with separate API keys. Configure usage plans to ensure all tenants are prevented from saturating the system with requests and to prevent lower tier tenants from impacting higher tier tenants. Have the ability to monitor and manage access at the entry point to your application.

title_full: SAAS03-BP02 Configure tier-based usage plans to protect premium tenants
title: Configure tier-based usage plans to protect premium tenants
description: For systems with tiered offerings (basic, advanced, premium), ensure lower tiers cannot impact reliability of premium tier tenants. Use API Gateway usage plans with different SLAs for each tier. A basic tier tenant placing extreme load via API could consume disproportionate resources and impact reliability for premium tenants. Configure throttling policies that examine tenant load, identify activity exceeding limits, and throttle their experience accordingly.

title_full: SAAS03-BP03 Publish tenant-aware health metrics for proactive reliability monitoring
title: Publish tenant-aware health metrics for proactive reliability monitoring
description: Surface additional reliability data providing detailed, tenant-aware insights into health trends of tenant workloads. Introduce code into your application to publish health insights with tenant context including consumption data, scaling insights, and latency metrics. Publish via log files or data warehouse to aggregate data. Build alarms, policies, and automation that can attempt to heal the system proactively before issues impact tenants or the entire system.

title_full: SAAS03-BP04 Create cross-tenant impact tests to validate noisy neighbor protection
title: Create cross-tenant impact tests to validate noisy neighbor protection
description: Create tests that simulate scenarios where a subset of tenants place disproportionate load on your system. Determine how the system responds when load is not distributed evenly among tenants and assess how this might affect overall tenant experience. If your system is decomposed into separately scalable services, create tests that validate scaling policies for each service to ensure they scale on the right criteria.

title_full: SAAS03-BP05 Test tenant consumption patterns with varied load profiles
title: Test tenant consumption patterns with varied load profiles
description: Create a range of load profiles (flat, spikey, random) that track both resource and tenant activity metrics. Determine the delta between consumption and tenant activity to use as part of a monitoring policy that identifies suboptimal resource consumption. Use this data to determine if instances are sized correctly, IOPS configured correctly, and AWS footprint is optimized.

title_full: SAAS03-BP06 Create tenant workflow tests to identify bottlenecks
title: Create tenant workflow tests to identify bottlenecks
description: Assess how different workflows of your SaaS application respond to load in a multi-tenant context. Pick well-known workflows and concentrate load with multiple tenants to determine if these workflows create bottlenecks or over-allocation of resources. This testing approach helps identify where specific application workflows may need optimization for multi-tenant scale.

title_full: SAAS03-BP07 Test tenant onboarding resilience under spike conditions
title: Test tenant onboarding resilience under spike conditions
description: Verify that tenant onboarding is resilient, scalable, and efficient especially when provisioning infrastructure during onboarding. Determine that spikes in activity don't overwhelm the onboarding process. Validate third-party integrations like billing can support their SLAs. Implement fallback strategies to handle potential outages for these integrations and introduce tests verifying fault tolerance mechanisms perform as expected.

title_full: SAAS03-BP08 Test API throttling policies across tenant tiers
title: Test API throttling policies across tenant tiers
description: Consider how tenants at different tiers can impose load via your API. A free tier tenant might not be allowed to impose the same load as a gold tier tenant. Create API throttling tests that verify throttling policies associated with each tier are being successfully applied and enforced. This ensures tier-based SLAs are maintained under various load conditions.

title_full: SAAS03-BP09 Test data distribution and sharding policies for tenant data
title: Test data distribution and sharding policies for tenant data
description: SaaS tenant data is often not uniformly distributed causing imbalances in overall data footprint that can affect performance and cost. Introduce sharding policies that account for and manage these variations. Create data distribution tests to verify sharding policies successfully distribute different patterns of tenant data. Having tests in place early helps avoid high costs of migrating to a new partitioning model after storing significant customer data.

title_full: SAAS03-BP10 Continuously test tenant isolation enforcement
title: Continuously test tenant isolation enforcement
description: SaaS customers expect every measure will be taken to ensure their environments are secured and inaccessible by other tenants. Build policies and mechanisms to secure each tenant's data and infrastructure. Introduce tests that continually validate the enforcement of these isolation policies. This is essential to any SaaS provider to maintain customer trust and meet security requirements.
